value.title: Get and use Python Libraries within Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Sometimes you need python libraries that aren't present by default in Microsoft Fabric. Patrick walks you through how to manage your python libraries, so they are available when you need them.  Manage Python libraries in Microsoft Fabric https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-science/python-guide/python-library-management

value.title: Get creative with buttons in Power BI!

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to dynamically filter by today's date. Using a date table, you can create a DAX measure that can then be used as a Power BI report-level filter to dynamically filter by today's date within Power BI Desktop.be  LET'S CONNECT! This type of connection is only supported by a limited number of data sources, and mainly targets systems with a huge amount of

value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

value.title: Import Azure Active Directory Users into Power BI   An Step toward Dynamic Row Level Security

There are other benefits also to import Azure Active Directory (AAD) users loaded into Power BI for
